title: Smoked haddock rarebit with chicory and radish salad
description: Welsh rarebit is essentially a very fancy version of cheese on toast. It’s the best kind, the kind made with careful precision, and everyone who is anyone has their own favourite way of making and eating it. In my recipe I like to flavour the cheese topping with mustard and Worcestershire sauce, and to mix in some poached smoked haddock for a little something extra.
ingredients: 2 x 150g/5½oz fillets of undyed smoked haddock, skin on, bones removed
4 large thick slices bread, e.g. sourdough or bloomer
salt and freshly ground black pepper
1 large handful radishes, trimmed and thinly sliced
2 heads chicory, leaves separated, larger leaves torn
salt and freshly ground black pepper
